an6.30:2.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā dassanāya gacchati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, dassanānaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā dassanāya gacchati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:2.5.en: The unsurpassable seeing is when someone with settled [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m, sure and devoted, goes to see a Realized One or their disciple. This is in order to purify sentient beings, to get past sorrow and crying, to make an end of pain and sadness, to end the cycle of suffering, and to realize extinguishment.

an6.30:3.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā dhammassavanāya gacchati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, savanānaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā dhammassavanāya gacchati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:3.5.en: The unsurpassable hearing is when someone with settled [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m, sure and devoted, goes to hear the teaching of a Realized One or one of his disciples. …

an6.30:4.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgate vā tathāgatasāvake vā saddhaṁ paṭilabhati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, lābhānaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgate vā tathāgatasāvake vā saddhaṁ paṭilabhati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:4.5.en: The unsurpassable acquisition is when someone with settled [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m, sure and devoted, acquires faith in a Realized One or their disciple. …

an6.30:5.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye adhisīlampi sikkhati, adhicittampi sikkhati, adhipaññampi sikkhati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, sikkhānaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye adhisīlampi sikkhati, adhicittampi sikkhati, adhipaññampi sikkhati, niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:5.5.en: The unsurpassable training is when someone with settled [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m, sure and devoted, trains in the higher ethics, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom in the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One. …

an6.30:6.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā paricarati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, pāricariyānaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā paricarati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:6.5.en: The unsurpassable service is when someone with settled [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m, sure and devoted, serves a Realized One or their disciple. …

an6.30:7.5.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā anussarati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno, etadānuttariyaṁ, bhikkhave, anussatīnaṁ sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṁ tathāgataṁ vā tathāgatasāvakaṁ vā anussarati niviṭṭhasaddho niviṭṭhapemo ekantagato abhippasanno.
an6.30:7.5.en: The unsurpassable recollection is when someone with settled [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m, sure and devoted, recollects a Realized One or their disciple. …

mn65:27.1.pli: Idha, bhaddāli, ekacco bhikkhu saddhāmattakena vahati pemamattakena.
mn65:27.1.en: Take some other monk who gets by with mere [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m.

mn65:27.3.pli: ‘ayaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu saddhāmattakena vahati pemamattakena.
mn65:27.3.en: ‘Reverends, this monk gets by with mere [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m.

mn65:27.5.pli: mā yampissa taṁ saddhāmattakaṁ pemamattakaṁ tamhāpi parihāyī’ti.
mn65:27.5.en: no, let him not lose what little [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m he has!’

mn65:28.3.pli: evameva kho, bhaddāli, idhekacco bhikkhu saddhāmattakena vahati pemamattakena.
mn65:28.3.en: In the same way, some monk gets by with mere [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m.

mn65:28.5.pli: ‘ayaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu saddhāmattakena vahati pemamattakena.
mn65:28.5.en: ‘Reverends, this monk gets by with mere [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m.

mn65:28.7.pli: mā yampissa taṁ saddhāmattakaṁ pemamattakaṁ tamhāpi parihāyī’ti.
mn65:28.7.en: no, let him not lose what little [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m he has!’

sn55.24:9.7.en: And they have a degree of [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m for the Buddha.

sn55.25:9.7.en: And they have a degree of [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m for the Buddha.

mn70:21.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te na kāyena phusitvā viharati, paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti, tathāgate cassa saddhāmattaṁ hoti pemamattaṁ, api cassa ime dhammā honti, seyyathidaṁ—
mn70:21.2.en: It’s a person who doesn’t have direct meditative experience of the peaceful liberations that are formless, transcending form. Nevertheless, having seen with wisdom, some of their defilements have come to an end. And they have a degree of [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m for the Realized One. And they have the following qualities:

mn22:47.2.pli: Evaṁ svākkhāte, bhikkhave, mayā dhamme uttāne vivaṭe pakāsite chinnapilotike yesaṁ mayi saddhāmattaṁ pemamattaṁ sabbe te saggaparāyanā”ti.
mn22:47.2.en: In this teaching there are those who have a degree of [38;5;121mfaith and love[0m for me. All of them are bound for heaven.”
